page.title: 19TONBRIDGE FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content: Tonbridge Football Club was formed in 1948 and soon became known as The Angels.They originally played on a ground which has now been redeveloped as a shopping complex. Their new ground,Longmead Stadium,was provided by the local council in 1980. There is no seating accommodation and the ground can hold 5000 supporters.It costs Â£1 to go to a match and 50p for old people and children.The average gate is about 350. They play in the Southern District of the Southern League,against towns inc- luding Hastings,Crawley,Canterbury, Folkestone,Ashford and Gravesend.In a normal year the team plays 21 games. The club is hoping to start a youth side in the future,but at present they need more sponsorship,and are hoping that local football will attract more families,as spectators.
